description: This button starts and stops the script and brings the console to front if it's open

The profile that is currently loaded.

TIP: To rename a profile, delete it first then change the name and save
The program/window name of your Kancolle container. Eg. Google Chrome, Firefox, KanColleViewer!, KanColleTool Viewer, Electronic Observer, etc.
Which built-in recovery method to use when you get cat bombed

Check this box if your viewer sometimes throws a popup that must be cleared (DMM popup, KC3Kai navigation warning popup due to KC3Kai updates, etc). Setting this to True will try hitting the Esc key to clear the popup before re-initializing the script from the beginning. Unfortunately does not work if the game is mid-sortie/combat
Specifies the desired # of menus to randomly walk through. The number of sidesteps range from 0 to the Paranoia value. Setting this value to at least 1 is recommended (0 to 1 sidesteps)

How often the script should run its loop, specified in full seconds. A lower value will make the script be quicker to respond to timers, while a higher value will make it slower, but perhaps guard against bot-detection

If you have a slow computer/network connection, you may encounter frequent FindFailed errors. Increase this value by whole numbers (seconds) to increase the length of all sleep/wait timers to avoid this

Check this box if you want the script to automatically sleep/pause at set times. Highly recommended that you check this box if you run the script for a long period of time

This overrides the other sleep options
Check this box if you want to invert the sleep times
The script will sleep during the highlighted time, just move the range around to adjust your sleep time
Check this box if you only want expeditions to automatically pause at set times. Highly recommended that you check this box if you run the script for a long period of time
Check this box if you want to invert the expedition sleep times
Expeditions will be paused during the highlighted time, just move the range around to adjust your sleep time
Check this box if you only want sorties to automatically pause at set times. Highly recommended that you check this box if you run the script for a long period of time
Check this box if you want to invert the sortie sleep times
Sorties will be paused during the highlighted time, just move the range around to adjust your sleep time
Set to True if you want the script to automatically stop and exit after a set number of hours, expeditions, sorties, or PvPs. You will have to manually restart the script after this
Define what you want to base the stop count on
Define how many of the above the script should perform before automatically stopping
Check this box if you want the script to stop after meeting the conditions below
Defines the amount of hours the script should run, after the running time exceeds this limit the script will stop, set to 0 to disable this condition
Defines a specific time when the script will stop, set hour or minute to -1 to disable this condition

Check this box if you want the script or only this module to stop after meeting the expedition conditions below, you can set the mode with the box adjacent to this checkbox

Remember to set the mode to "Module" if you just want to stop this module!
Defines the amount of expeditions the script/module should run, after the expedition count exceeds this limit the script/module will stop, set to 0 to disable this condition
Defines a specific time when the script/module will stop, set hour or minute to -1 to disable this condition

Check this box if you want the script or only this module to stop after meeting the sortie conditions below, you can set the mode with the box adjacent to this checkbox

Remember to set the mode to "Module" if you just want to stop this module!
Defines the amount of sorties the script/module should run, after the sortie count exceeds this limit the script/module will stop, set to 0 to disable this condition
Defines a specific time when the script/module will stop, set hour or minute to -1 to disable this condition
Check this box if you want to enable sorties

Legacy: Per node definition of formations and night battles, low CPU usage.

Live / Dynamic: Auto node detection with optional formation and night battle overrides, high CPU usages
Type of fleet the script should sortie
The map the script should sortie the fleet
Maximum number of combat nodes to run. Resource/hazard nodes do not count
Fleet presets to use during sortie as ordered in the fleet preset screen
Forces the script to retreat at the specified nodes
Specify which nodes to choose when the script arrives at a branch
Formations to use at each combat node
Whether or not to engage in night battle at each combat node
Specifies the damage level (of any ship) in which to retreat from a sortie
Specifies the damage level (of any ship) to repair before sortieing again. The script will not sortie if any ships are at in this damage level
Set the repair time limit for repairs. The script will automatically use a bucket to repair a ship if its repair time is above this # of hours
Several options that are checked before and after sortieing
Reserves a single dock when trying to repair ships, useful for preventing repairs from blocking continuous sorties but may increase bucket usage
Whether or not to consider fatigue/morale before sorties. If the ships have an unhappy face (morale of 29 or below) the script will wait for a set amount of time for morale to recover

Whether or not to sortie when the port (ship slots) is full. Check this box if you do not want sorties to occur when your port is full. Port checking is automatically done when sortieing to Event maps, since sortieing is prohibited when you do not have 5 free ship slots
Check this box if you want the script to stop sortieing to the specified map once the map has been cleared. Only applicable to the monthly EOs (1-5, 2-5, 3-5, 4-5, 5-5)

Set whether or not to 'push' past the max number of defined combat nodes, REGARDLESS OF THE STATE OF YOUR FLEET. Only do this if the last node is a resource/non-combat node, like the end of 1-6, and only if your path is 100% fixed!

WARNING: YOU MAY LOSE SHIPS WITH THIS SET TO TRUE. PLEASE STUDY THE MAP YOU ARE SORTIEING TO AND MAKE AN EDUCATED DECISION
Check this box if you want to enable automatic reset of event difficulty (Map gauge)
Sets the frequency of resetting the event difficulty in units of sorties
The difficulty you want to farm the map with
The difficulty that the script tries to reset to temporarily then back to farm difficulty
Check this box if you want to enable pvp

Specify which saved fleet composition should be used for pvp, with the first saved fleet being 1.

NOTE: this value is only relevant if both PvP and Combat modules are enabled with different fleets assigned to them!
Check this box if you want to enable expeditions
The expeditions fleet 2 should go on. If this Fleet hasn't been unlocked or you don't want it to run an expedition, just leave it empty
The expeditions fleet 3 should go on. If this Fleet hasn't been unlocked or you don't want it to run an expedition, just leave it empty
The expeditions fleet 4 should go on. If this Fleet hasn't been unlocked or you don't want it to run an expedition, just leave it empty
Check this box if you want the script to manage quests

Script will check the following quest groups for valid quests and try to complete them.
This module is context aware and will only for example try to complete PvP quests only if PvP module is enabled.
How often should quests be checked? Settings this to 1 will make quests be checked after every expedition and sortie
Which nodes to send LBAS group 1 to, only enabled if 2 nodes are specified
Which nodes to send LBAS group 2 to, only enabled if 2 nodes are specified
Which nodes to send LBAS group 3 to, only enabled if 2 nodes are specified

Prevent computer from activating lockscreen when the script is active, useful when you set the script to only expeditions and it idles longer than your lockscreen activation time, otherwise the script crashes when your computer locks itself
Clears console before a new session is started if enabled
If enabled and the script crashes for some reason, KAGA will automatically spawn a new session
Number of retries KAGA should try to restart the script
Prints out useful information about the internal state of KAGA, letting you get a clearer picture of what's happening if enabled
Automatically opens the debug console on the start of KAGA if enabled
Automatically opens the stats window on the start of KAGA if enabled
Checks for KAGA updates on startup if enabled

Report status to YuuBot on discord, YuuBot provides commands to query the status of the script when you are away and also notifies you when your script has crashed.

Your API key can be found using the "!kaga --key" command on discord. If this box turns green, then you're set! See KAGA Github Wiki for more information.

 Clicking link opens a Discord channel invite.

Status reports occur at the start of the script, end of the script and every time it finishes one cycle. Crashes are reported after the crash log has been saved.

Status may include all the data you see in the Session Stats window and current profile name, crash reports may include a copy of the last 1000 lines of log.

Please be advised of using this feature if you want to keep privacy, as other users will be able to query your script status. No other data is send or received otherwise.
Shortcut for starting and stopping the script, this should be a + delimited list of keys and modifiers (CTRL, SHIFT, ALT, META)
Check this box if you want ships to be switched around
Criteria for ship in slot 1 to be eligible to be switched out
Criteria for ship in slot 2 to be eligible to be switched out
Criteria for ship in slot 3 to be eligible to be switched out
Criteria for ship in slot 4 to be eligible to be switched out
Criteria for ship in slot 5 to be eligible to be switched out
Criteria for ship in slot 6 to be eligible to be switched out
Criteria for what kind of ships are eligible to be switched into slot 1
Criteria for what kind of ships are eligible to be switched into slot 2
Criteria for what kind of ships are eligible to be switched into slot 3
Criteria for what kind of ships are eligible to be switched into slot 4
Criteria for what kind of ships are eligible to be switched into slot 5
Criteria for what kind of ships are eligible to be switched into slot 6
Path to the sikuli script Jar
Path to kcauto root directory
